medical_history.chief_complaint: Ectopia cordis, a congenital anomaly with an extrathoracic heart.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at birth in February 1992. The patient presented with three major congenital defects: an extrathoracic heart, complete absence of the sternum, and a minimal omphalocele. The heart was covered with bilateral pectoral skin flaps immediately after birth. Several episodes of respiratory infection occurred in the first year due to impaired pulmonary function. At 14 months, the chest wall required reconstruction due to recurring impairment in pulmonary function after the initial surgical correction.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had no significant past medical conditions reported aside from the congenital defects at birth.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's older sister previously required surgical repair of a cleft sternum at age 5 years.
medical_history.social_history: The patient engages in an age-appropriate lifestyle, including sports such as soccer, without restrictions.
